page.title: 05Fauna of Silverdale
page.content: Wildlife includes small rodents, rabbits, and hare. Hedgehogs are common. Fox can be seen at Heald Brow. Roe deer also frequent the area. Red squirrel are found in the woodlands, and common species of bat are recorded in the area. All the common woodland birds are to be seen along with wood pigeons and collared dove. Jays are frequently seen and heard, along with tawny owls. Kestrels can be seen hovering around Jenny Brown's Point. Redstarts are rare, but have been spotted near Leighton Moss. The yellowhammer and linnet prefer gorse areas. The birds of the shoreline include shelduck, oystercatcher, gulls, and wildfowl. Nearly a third of the British varieties of butterfly can be found, the commonest being the small heath.
